alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 4:35PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall from showers and thunderstorms training over the same area is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training showers and thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Remote areas between state Highway 80 and the Dragoon mountains. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
